title: Missing Return Statement
description: This function should return the sum of two numbers, but it's not working. What's the bug?
explanation: The function calculates the sum but never returns it. Add 'return sum;' before the closing brace.

title: Array Index Out of Bounds
description: This code tries to access array elements but crashes. What's wrong?
buggyCode:
numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
for i in range(6):
    print(numbers[i])
    
# IndexError: list index out of range
explanation: The array has 5 elements (indices 0-4), but the loop runs 6 times (0-5). Change range(6) to range(len(numbers)).

title: State Update Not Reflecting
description: Clicking the button doesn't update the counter. Why?
explanation: Regular variables don't trigger re-renders in React. Use const [count, setCount] = useState(0) and setCount(count + 1) in the increment function.

title: Infinite Loop Alert
description: This loop never stops! What's the issue?
explanation: The variable 'i' never increases, so the condition 'i < 10' is always true. Add 'i++' inside the loop to increment i.

title: Null Pointer Exception
description: This code crashes with NullPointerException. What's the bug?
options: Trying to call method on null object
explanation: You cannot call methods on a null reference. Check if name != null before calling name.length(), or initialize name with a value.

title: Async Await Missing
description: The data is always undefined. What's missing?
explanation: fetch() returns a Promise. Make the function async and use await: 'const response = await fetch(...)' and 'const data = await response.json()'.

title: Comparison Type Coercion
description: This condition should be false but it's true. Why?
options: False is not a valid value
explanation: The == operator performs type coercion. '0' is converted to 0, which equals false. Use === for strict equality or check if (value === 'false').

title: Closure Variable Scope
description: All buttons alert '3'. What's the bug?
options: var has function scope, use let for block scope
explanation: var has function scope, so all closures reference the same 'i' which is 3 after the loop. Use 'let i = 0' for block scope, creating a new binding for each iteration.

title: Division by Zero
description: This calculator crashes when dividing. What's wrong?
buggyCode:
def divide(a, b):
    return a / b

result = divide(10, 0)
# ZeroDivisionError
options: No check for division by zero
explanation: Dividing by zero causes an error. Add a check: if b == 0: return 'Cannot divide by zero' before the division.

title: Off-by-One Array Access
description: Getting undefined for the last element. Why?
explanation: Arrays are zero-indexed. Start the loop at i = 0, not i = 1, and use i < arr.length (not <=) to avoid accessing arr[5] which doesn't exist.

title: Missing Break in Switch
description: Switch statement executes multiple cases. What's missing?
explanation: Without break statements, execution 'falls through' to subsequent cases. Add 'break;' after each console.log() to prevent this.

title: String Concatenation vs Addition
description: Getting '510' instead of 15. Why?
options: String concatenation instead of numeric addition
explanation: When one operand is a string, + performs concatenation. Convert 'a' to a number: const sum = Number(a) + b or parseInt(a) + b.

title: Semicolon Missing
description: Code behaves unexpectedly. What's the issue?
options: Missing semicolon causes array to be treated as index
explanation: Without a semicolon after 'const value = 5', JavaScript interprets it as value = 5[1,2,3], trying to access index [1,2,3] on 5. Add a semicolon after the first line.

title: Uninitialized Variable
description: Getting NameError. What's wrong?
buggyCode:
def calculate():
    total = total + 5
    return total

result = calculate()
# UnboundLocalError: local variable 'total' referenced before assignment
explanation: You cannot use a variable before assigning it a value. Initialize it first: total = 0 before adding to it.

title: useEffect Dependency Missing
description: Component doesn't update when prop changes. Why?
explanation: The empty dependency array [] means the effect only runs once. Add userId to dependencies: [userId] so it re-runs when userId changes.

title: Floating Point Precision
description: 0.1 + 0.2 doesn't equal 0.3. What's happening?
explanation: Floating point arithmetic has precision limitations. Use a tolerance: Math.abs(sum - 0.3) < Number.EPSILON or round to fixed decimals.

title: Modifying Const Object
description: This shouldn't work, but it does. Why?
explanation: const prevents reassigning the variable, but object properties can still be modified. Use Object.freeze(user) to prevent mutations or use a library like Immer.

title: Array Sort Numeric Issue
description: Numbers not sorting correctly. What's wrong?
options: Sort converts to strings by default
explanation: sort() converts elements to strings and sorts lexicographically. For numeric sort, use: numbers.sort((a, b) => a - b).

title: This Binding Lost
description: Method call fails. What's the issue?
explanation: 'this' is lost when passing a method as a callback. Fix: setTimeout(() => counter.increment(), 1000) or bind it: counter.increment.bind(counter).

title: Race Condition
description: Counter value is wrong after multiple clicks. Why?
explanation: Multiple async operations read the same initial value before updating. Use atomic operations or a queue, or in React, use the functional setState form: setCount(c => c + 1).

title: Memory Leak Event Listener
description: App slows down over time. What's causing it?
options: Missing cleanup function to remove listener
explanation: Event listeners accumulate without cleanup. Return a cleanup function: return () => window.removeEventListener('resize', handleResize);

title: Stale Closure
description: Interval always logs 0. What's wrong?
explanation: The interval closure captures the initial count (0). Either add count to dependencies or use a ref to access current value, or use setCount(c => c + 1) if you need updates.

title: Wrong Comparison Operator
description: Assignment instead of comparison. What's the bug?
buggyCode:
x = 5
if x = 5:
    print('Five')

# SyntaxError: invalid syntax
explanation: = is assignment, == is comparison. Change 'if x = 5' to 'if x == 5' to compare values.

title: Mutable Default Argument
description: List keeps growing unexpectedly. Why?
buggyCode:
def add_item(item, items=[]):
    items.append(item)
    return items

print(add_item(1))  # [1]
print(add_item(2))  # [1, 2] - Expected [2]!
options: Default argument list is shared across calls
explanation: Default mutable arguments are created once and shared. Use None as default: def add_item(item, items=None): items = items or []

title: Key Prop Missing
description: React warning about keys in list. What's needed?
options: Missing unique key prop on list items
explanation:
React needs unique keys to track list items. Add key prop: todos.map(todo =>
  • {todo.text}
    • )

title: Hoisting Issue
description: Variable is undefined before declaration. Why?
options: var is hoisted but not initialized
explanation: var declarations are hoisted to the top but not initialized. Use let or const which throw ReferenceError if accessed before declaration.

title: Integer Division
description: Getting wrong result. What's the issue?
buggyCode:
result = 7 / 2
print(result)  # 3.5 in Python 3
# Expected 3 (integer division)
explanation: In Python 3, / always returns float. For integer division (floor division), use // operator: result = 7 // 2 gives 3.

title: JSON Parse Error
description: JSON parsing fails. What's wrong?
options: JSON requires double quotes, not single
explanation: Valid JSON uses double quotes for property names and string values. Change to: {"name": "John", "age": 30}

title: Callback vs Promise
description: Data is undefined. What's the issue?
explanation: The promise chain isn't returned. Add 'return' before fetch(): return fetch('/api/data')... or use async/await pattern.

title: Boolean Coercion
description: Empty array is truthy? Why?
explanation: In JavaScript, all objects (including empty arrays) are truthy. Check the length property explicitly: if (arr.length > 0)

title: Indentation Error
description: Getting IndentationError. What's wrong?
explanation: Python requires indentation for code blocks. Indent the print statement: print(f'Hello {name}') should be indented with 4 spaces or a tab.

title: Object Reference Copy
description: Changing one object affects the other. Why?
explanation: Assignment copies the reference, not the object. Create a new object: const copy = { ...original } or const copy = Object.assign({}, original).

title: Event Propagation
description: Parent click fires when child is clicked. Why?
buggyCode: // Both handlers fire when button clicked
explanation: Events bubble up the DOM tree. Stop propagation in child handler: e.stopPropagation() or use event capturing phase.

title: Missing Await
description: Getting Promise instead of data. What's missing?
explanation: Async functions return Promises. Use await to get the resolved value: const user = await fetchUser(id);

title: Array Filter Mutation
description: Original array modified. What went wrong?
explanation: Never mutate an array while iterating it. Filter creates a new array, don't modify the original. Remove the splice call entirely.

title: String Immutability
description: String doesn't change. Why?
explanation: Strings are immutable. Create a new string: str = 'H' + str.slice(1) or str = str.replace('h', 'H').

title: Template Literal Syntax
description: Variable not interpolating. What's wrong?
options: Use backticks ` not quotes ' for template literals
explanation: Template literals require backticks, not quotes. Change to: const greeting = `Hello ${name}`;

title: Forgotten Return in Map
description: Getting undefined array items. Why?
options: Missing return statement in arrow function
explanation: Arrow functions with braces need explicit return. Either remove braces: n => n * 2, or add return: { return n * 2; }

title: List Mutation in Loop
description: Not all items removed. What's wrong?
options: Modifying list while iterating causes skip
explanation: Modifying a list during iteration causes the iterator to skip elements. Use list comprehension instead: numbers = [num for num in numbers if num % 2 != 0]

title: CSS Z-Index Not Working
description: Element won't appear above others. Why?
options: z-index only works on positioned elements
explanation: z-index only works on positioned elements (position: relative, absolute, fixed, or sticky). Add position: relative; to the .overlay class.

title: SQL Injection Vulnerability
description: Query is vulnerable. What's the issue?
explanation: Never concatenate user input into SQL. Use parameterized queries: db.query('SELECT * FROM users WHERE email = ?', [userInput])

title: Async Function Not Awaited
description: Code executes before data loads. Why?
options: loadData() returns Promise, need to await it
explanation: Async functions return Promises. Either await it: await loadData(); or use .then(): loadData().then(() => console.log('Data loaded'));

title: Destructuring Error
description: Cannot destructure undefined. What's wrong?
explanation: Cannot destructure null or undefined. Add a check: if (user) { const { name, age } = user; } or use default: const { name, age } = user || {};

title: Wrong Array Method
description: push returns length, not array. What's wrong?
options: push modifies original and returns length
explanation: push modifies the original array and returns its new length. Use concat or spread: const newArray = [...numbers, 4]; or numbers.concat(4);

title: Scope Issue with Let
description: Variable not accessible. Why?
options: let has block scope, not function scope
explanation: let and const have block scope. Declare message outside the if block, or use var (not recommended): let message; if (true) { message = 'Hello'; }

title: Class Method Not Bound
description: Method loses 'this' context. Why?
options: Method not bound, this context lost
explanation: Class methods aren't auto-bound. Use arrow function: handleClick = () => { ... } or bind it: btn.handleClick.bind(btn)

title: Set Timeout Zero
description: Unexpected execution order. Why?
options: Event loop - setTimeout callback queued after current stack
explanation: Even with 0ms delay, setTimeout callbacks are queued in the event loop and execute after the current call stack completes. This is expected behavior.

title: Incorrect Reduce Initial Value
description: Getting NaN from reduce. What's wrong?
explanation: Always provide an initial value: numbers.reduce((acc, num) => acc + num, 0). Without it, reduce fails on empty arrays.

title: Dictionary Key Error
description: KeyError when accessing dict. What's wrong?
explanation: Accessing non-existent key raises KeyError. Use get() method with default: user.get('email', 'N/A') or check key existence: if 'email' in user:

title: Controlled Input Issue
description: Input field is read-only. Why?
explanation: Controlled inputs need onChange handler: <input value={value} onChange={(e) => setValue(e.target.value)} />

title: Arrow Function Object Return
description: Returning undefined instead of object. Why?
buggyCode:
const getUser = () => { name: 'John', age: 30 };
console.log(getUser()); // undefined
options: Braces interpreted as function body, not object
explanation: Wrap object in parentheses to distinguish from function body: const getUser = () => ({ name: 'John', age: 30 });

title: Import Error
description: Cannot find module. What's wrong?
buggyCode:
import Button from './Button';
// Error: Cannot find module './Button'
explanation: Include file extension or ensure module resolution is configured: import Button from './Button.jsx' or check if file exists and exports are correct.

title: Triple Equals vs Double Equals
description: Comparison gives unexpected result. Why?
buggyCode:
console.log(0 == false);  // true
console.log(0 === false); // false
options: == coerces types, === checks type and value
explanation: == performs type coercion, === checks both type and value. Always prefer === for strict equality to avoid unexpected type conversions.

title: Math.random Not Called
description: Getting the same 'random' value. Why?
explanation: Functions need parentheses to execute. Change to: const random = Math.random(); to call the function and get a random number.

title: Forgotten Async Keyword
description: await is not allowed. What's missing?
explanation: await can only be used inside async functions. Add async keyword: async function getData() { ... }

title: Promise All Failure
description: One failure breaks everything. Why?
options: Promise.all rejects if any promise rejects
explanation: Promise.all fails fast on first rejection. Use Promise.allSettled() to handle individual failures: await Promise.allSettled(promises);

title: Undefined vs Null
description: Checking for null doesn't work. Why?
options: Uninitialized variables are undefined, not null
explanation: Uninitialized variables are undefined, not null. Check for both: if (value == null) uses == to match both, or check explicitly: value === null || value === undefined

title: SetState Not Immediate
description: State doesn't update immediately. Why?
explanation: React state updates are asynchronous and batched. Use useEffect to react to state changes, or log the new value directly: console.log(count + 1);

title: Try-Catch Doesn't Catch
description: Async error not caught. Why?
explanation: try-catch doesn't catch async errors. Put try-catch inside the callback: setTimeout(() => { try { throw new Error('Oops!'); } catch(e) { ... } }, 1000);

title: Regex Escape Issue
description: Regex not matching dots. What's wrong?
options: Dot matches any character, needs escaping
explanation: In regex, . matches any character. To match literal dot, escape it: const pattern = /\./; or use character class: /[.]/

title: CSS Specificity Issue
description: Styles not applying. Why?
options: ID selector has higher specificity than class
explanation: CSS specificity: inline styles > IDs > classes > elements. #header .button has higher specificity due to ID. Use !important (last resort) or increase specificity.

title: Array Includes Gotcha
description: includes returns false. What's wrong?
options: indexOf uses === which fails for NaN
explanation: indexOf uses strict equality (===), and NaN !== NaN. includes uses SameValueZero algorithm which correctly handles NaN. Prefer includes for NaN checks.

title: Git Merge Conflict
description: Merge conflict markers in code. How to resolve?
buggyCode:
<<<<<<< HEAD
const version = 1;
=======
const version = 2;
>>>>>>> feature-branch
options: Manually resolve by choosing correct version
explanation: Git conflict markers show both versions. Manually edit to keep desired code, remove markers, then git add and commit the resolved file.

title: LocalStorage String Only
description: Getting '[object Object]' from localStorage. Why?
explanation: localStorage only stores strings. Stringify objects: localStorage.setItem('user', JSON.stringify(user)); and parse when retrieving: JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('user'));

title: Spread vs Rest
description: Syntax error with spread. What's wrong?
options: Rest parameter must be last in parameter list
explanation: Rest parameter (...numbers) must be the last parameter. Change to: function sum(multiplier, ...numbers) { ... }

title: Missing Semicolon ASI
description: Function returns wrong value. Why?
explanation: JavaScript inserts semicolon after return, making it return undefined. Put opening brace on same line: return { value: 42 };

title: Map vs forEach Return
description: forEach returns undefined. Why?
options: forEach returns undefined, use map instead
explanation: forEach executes a function but returns undefined. Use map to transform arrays: const doubled = numbers.map(n => n * 2);

title: Async IIFE Syntax
description: Syntax error with async IIFE. What's wrong?
explanation: IIFE needs parentheses around function: (async function() { ... })(); or use arrow function: (async () => { ... })();

title: TypeScript Any Type
description: No type checking on variable. Why?
explanation: any type bypasses TypeScript's type checking. Use specific types: let value: string | number or unknown (safer than any) for better type safety.

title: Import Default vs Named
description: Import doesn't work. What's the issue?
options: Named export needs curly braces in import
explanation: Named exports need curly braces: import { helper } from './utils'; Default export: export default helper; then import helper from './utils';

title: Undefined Object Property
description: Getting undefined instead of value. Why?
buggyCode:
const user = { name: 'John', age: 30 };
console.log(user.email); // undefined
explanation: Accessing non-existent properties returns undefined. Check existence: user.email || 'N/A' or use optional chaining: user?.email

title: CSS Flexbox Not Working
description: Items not arranging in row. What's missing?
explanation: Flexbox properties only work on flex containers. Add display: flex; to activate flexbox layout on the container.

title: Console Log Object Reference
description: Object shows different values in console. Why?
explanation: Some browsers show live object reference in console. To see value at log time, use: console.log(JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(obj)))

title: Array Constructor Gotcha
description: Array has unexpected length. Why?
options: Single number creates array of that length
explanation: new Array(n) creates array with n empty slots. Use literal syntax: const arr = [5] or Array.from({ length: 5 }, (_, i) => i) for filled array.

title: SetInterval Not Cleared
description: Timer keeps running. What's missing?
explanation: Store interval ID and clear in cleanup: const id = setInterval(...); return () => clearInterval(id); to prevent memory leaks.

title: Optional Chaining Gotcha
description: Optional chaining doesn't prevent error. Why?
options: Need chaining at each level: user?.profile?.name
user should be undefined not null
explanation: Optional chaining only short-circuits at that level. If profile is undefined, accessing .name still throws. Use: user?.profile?.name

title: Date Constructor Gotcha
description: Month is off by one. Why?
buggyCode:
const date = new Date(2024, 3, 15);
console.log(date); // April 15, not March 15!
explanation: In JavaScript Date, months are 0-indexed: 0=January, 1=February, etc. Use new Date(2024, 2, 15) for March 15.

title: ParseInt Without Radix
description: Parsing gives wrong number. Why?
buggyCode:
console.log(parseInt('08')); // 8 (correct)
console.log(parseInt('010')); // 8 or 10 depending on browser
options: Leading zero interpreted as octal, specify radix
explanation: Always specify radix (base): parseInt('010', 10) for decimal. Without radix, leading zeros may be interpreted as octal in older browsers.

title: Switch Statement Fallthrough
description: Multiple cases execute. What's happening?
options: Intentional fallthrough, add break if not desired
explanation: Cases without break fall through to next case. This is intentional for grouping cases, but add break if you want to stop: case 'B': console.log('Good'); break;

title: Object Keys Are Strings
description: Numeric keys behave strangely. Why?
options: Object keys are always strings, 1 and '1' are same
explanation: Object keys are always strings. obj[1] and obj['1'] reference the same property. Use Map for numeric keys: const map = new Map();

title: Unhandled Promise Rejection
description: Error not caught. What's missing?
options: Missing error handling with try-catch or .catch()
explanation: Always handle promise rejections: fetchData().catch(err => console.error(err)); or wrap await in try-catch block.

title: Regex Greedy Matching
description: Regex matches too much. Why?
explanation: * is greedy by default. Use non-greedy *?: /<div>.*?<\/div>/g to match each div separately. Better: use DOM parser for HTML.

title: Forgotten Bind
description: Method can't access this. Why?
options: Method not bound, use arrow function or bind
explanation: Class methods lose 'this' binding. Use arrow function: increment = () => { ... } or bind in constructor: this.increment = this.increment.bind(this);

title: Package Not Found
description: Module not found error. What's wrong?
buggyCode:
const express = require('express');
// Error: Cannot find module 'express'
options: Package not installed, run npm install express
explanation: Module must be installed first. Run: npm install express or yarn add express to install the package.

title: CSS Position Absolute Issue
description: Element positioning relative to wrong parent. Why?
explanation: position: absolute positions relative to nearest positioned ancestor. Add position: relative; to parent to establish positioning context.

title: Array Slice vs Splice
description: Array mutated unexpectedly. Why?
explanation: splice modifies original array. Use slice for non-mutating copy: const copy = arr.slice(1, 3); Original array remains unchanged.

title: Implicit Type Coercion
description: Unexpected result from operation. Why?
buggyCode:
console.log('5' - 3);  // 2
console.log('5' + 3);  // '53'
console.log('5' * 3);  // 15
options: + concatenates strings, other ops coerce to number
explanation: + operator performs string concatenation if either operand is string. Other arithmetic operators (-, *, /) coerce strings to numbers. Use explicit Number() for clarity.

title: Duplicate Key in Object
description: Object has fewer properties than expected. Why?
explanation: Duplicate object keys are allowed, but the last value overwrites previous ones. Ensure unique keys or use different property names.

title: Middleware Order
description: Route not working. What's the issue?
options: Middleware must be registered before routes
explanation: Middleware order matters. Register middleware before routes: app.use(express.json()) must come before app.get() definitions.

title: React Key with Index
description: List items behave incorrectly. Why?
options: Using index as key causes issues on reorder
explanation: Index as key breaks when list is reordered/filtered. Use stable unique IDs: key={todo.id}. React uses keys to track identity.

title: CSS Margin Collapse
description: Margins not adding up. What's happening?
options: Vertical margins collapse to largest value
explanation: Adjacent vertical margins collapse to the larger value, not sum. Use padding, flexbox gap, or single margin to avoid collapse.

title: Trim Not Called
description: String still has whitespace. Why?
options: trim returns new string, doesn't mutate
explanation: Strings are immutable. trim() returns a new string. Use: text = text.trim(); to assign the trimmed value back.

title: CORS Error
description: API request blocked. What's the issue?
options: Server needs to allow CORS headers
explanation: CORS errors require server-side fix. Backend must include headers like Access-Control-Allow-Origin. Use a proxy during development as workaround.

title: UseEffect Infinite Loop
description: Component re-renders infinitely. Why?
explanation: Updating a dependency inside useEffect causes infinite loop. Use functional update: setData(prev => [...prev, newItem]); and remove data from dependencies.

title: Bitwise vs Logical OR
description: Boolean check gives unexpected result. Why?
buggyCode:
const hasAccess = isAdmin | isModerator;
console.log(hasAccess); // 0 or 1, not true/false
options: Single | is bitwise, use || for logical OR
explanation: | is bitwise OR (works on bits), || is logical OR (works on boolean values). Use: const hasAccess = isAdmin || isModerator;

title: Wrong Array Method Chain
description: Method chaining fails. What's wrong?
explanation: forEach returns undefined. Use map for transformations: [1, 2, 3].map(n => n * 2).filter(n => n > 2);

title: JSON Circular Reference
description: JSON.stringify fails. Why?
explanation: JSON can't handle circular references. Remove circular references or use a library like flatted, or provide a replacer function to JSON.stringify.

title: Form Submit Refresh
description: Page refreshes on form submit. How to prevent?
buggyCode:
<form onSubmit={handleSubmit}>
  <button type="submit">Submit</button>
</form>

function handleSubmit() {
  console.log('Submitted');
}
explanation: Forms trigger page reload by default. Prevent it: function handleSubmit(e) { e.preventDefault(); /* your code */ }

title: Async Function in useEffect
description: ESLint warning about async in useEffect. Why?
options: useEffect can't be async, create inner async function
explanation: useEffect expects sync function or cleanup function, not Promise. Create inner async function: useEffect(() => { async function load() { ... } load(); }, []);

title: Const Reassignment
description: Getting TypeError on reassignment. Why?
explanation: const prevents reassignment. Use let if you need to reassign: let PI = 3.14; PI = 3.14159; or use a different variable name.

title: Spread Operator Shallow Copy
description: Nested object still shared. Why?
options: Spread creates shallow copy, nested objects shared
explanation: Spread operator creates shallow copy. Nested objects are still referenced. Use deep clone: structuredClone(original) or JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(original)) (with caveats).

title: SetTimeout This Context
description: Method loses this inside timeout. Why?
options: Regular function loses this, use arrow function
explanation: Regular functions have their own this. Use arrow function to preserve context: setTimeout(() => { this.seconds++; }, 1000);

title: Array Find Returns Undefined
description: Can't find item that exists. What's wrong?
options: Type mismatch: comparing number to string
explanation: Strict equality fails due to type mismatch (number !== string). Use correct type: u.id === 2 or convert: u.id === Number('2')

title: CSS Selector Specificity
description: Style not applying. Why?
options: div p has higher specificity than single class
explanation: Specificity: element + element (0,0,2) beats single class (0,1,0)? No, class wins. Actually text should be red. If blue, check CSS order or increase specificity.

title: Promise Then Chain Break
description: Promise chain stops early. Why?
explanation: Each then must return a value for the next then: .then(res => { console.log(res); return res.json(); })

title: Object Destructuring Rename
description: Variable name conflict. How to rename?
explanation: Rename during destructuring: const { name: userName } = user; Now use userName instead of name.

title: Array Some vs Every
description: Getting wrong boolean result. Why?
options: every checks if ALL match, use some for ANY
explanation: every returns true if ALL elements match. Use some to check if ANY element matches: numbers.some(n => n % 2 === 1)

title: Variable Shadowing
description: Outer variable not updating. Why?
options: Inner declaration shadows outer, causes RHS lookup before assignment
explanation: Inner let count tries to read count before it's initialized (TDZ). Either remove let to use outer: count = count + 1; or use different name: let newCount = count + 1;

title: HTML Semantics
question: Which element is used for the main content of a document?
explanation: <main> represents the dominant content of the body.
